title: Case Study: Fractured Hip in an Elderly Patient
clinical_history: Mrs. Thompson is an 82-year-old retired librarian who was admitted to the hospital after a fall at home. She reported hearing a loud crack and experiencing severe pain in her left hip. She was unable to bear weight on the affected side and had difficulty moving her leg. She was diagnosed with a fractured hip and underwent surgery to repair the fracture. Currently, she is experiencing pain and stiffness in her hip and thigh.
aggrevating_factors: weight-bearing activities such as walking, standing, and climbing stairs; movement of the affected hip
picture: A 24-hour picture of Mrs. Thompson showing her limited mobility and pain while moving
past_history: history of osteoporosis, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia; previous fractures of the wrist and ankle
personal_history: widowed, lives alone, and has limited social support; difficulty with activities of daily living due to pain and limited mobility
imaging: X-rays and CT scans of the hip and pelvis showing the fracture
